Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies took on the Toronto Blue Jays this week and won both games 10-9 and 4-2.
In their first pair of games against the Marlins, the Phillies won 5-2 and 16-2.
Saturday’s game against the Marlins was a loss 9-5 with Aaron Nola giving up four earned in 4.2 innings.
Seth Johnson will make his MLB debut as the starting pitcher for the Phillies.
Over on the Marlins’ side, they split their last two games against the Washington Nationals.
Max Meyer will start for the Marlins. Meyer is 3-5 with a 5.84 ERA in 11 starts and 3-6 with a 5.86 ERA in 13 career starts.
Five of the last six games between the Phillies and Marlins at LoanDepot Park have gone OVER the total runs line.
Six of the Phillies' last eight road games against NL East opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.

The 'Inning 1 OVER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Phillies' last five road games.
